title: How to Clean Swarovski Crystals

methods.name: Cleaning with a Dry Lint-Free Cloth

steps.headline: Hold your crystal jewelry in one hand and the lint-free cloth in the other.
steps.description: You may also want to wear cotton gloves to handle your jewelry since fingerprints may show up on the crystals if you handle them with your bare hands. Your best bet is to use the dry cloth method for light cleaning or general maintenance of your Swarovski crystal jewelry.

steps.headline: Polish the crystals.
steps.description: Use the lint free cloth to gently polish each crystal individually. Use a small circular motion to polish each crystal. Polishing your Swarovski crystal jewelry periodically with a lint free cloth is the best way to maintain the luster of your jewelry and keep it looking beautiful for years.

steps.headline: Continue polishing your jewelry.
steps.description: Keep working until you have cleaned all of the crystals and you are satisfied with the results. If your crystal jewelry still looks dull or dirty, you can use a wet cleaning method.

steps.headline: Gather your materials.
steps.description: You will need a soft bristle toothbrush (an old one that you don't plan on using again will work fine), some dish soap, a small bowl with water in it, and a lint free towel. This method of cleaning your Swarovski crystal jewelry works best for deep cleaning or occasional maintenance. Don't use this method too often because it may wear off some of the thin protective plating on the crystals.

steps.headline: Moisten a soft bristle toothbrush.
steps.description: You may want to keep a small bowl of water handy to moisten the toothbrush as you clean the crystals.

steps.headline: Apply a small amount of dish soap to the  damp toothbrush.
steps.description: Only use a small amount at first and add more as you go if needed.

steps.headline: Clean the crystals.
steps.description: Use the toothbrush to gently remove dirt from each crystal individually. Do not scrub the crystals. Move the toothbrush in a circular motion to gently clean away dirt. Focus on cleaning one crystal at a time.

steps.headline: Rinse away soap.
steps.description: Hold your crystals under a stream of warm running water to rinse away the soap. (CAUTION: The crystals will be slippery. You may want to place a small bowl or colander over the drain just in case you drop your crystals.)

steps.headline: Dry your crystals.
steps.description: Gently pat dry your jewelry using a soft lint free cloth. You may also want to lay out your jewelry on the cloth until you are sure that it is completely dry. Do not put away your jewelry until it is completely dry.

steps.headline: Put on your jewelry last.
steps.description: Wait until after you have applied your lotion, makeup, perfume, and hair products to put on your crystal jewelry. If you put your jewelry on before these products, you may smudge your jewelry or end up getting harsh chemicals on your jewelry that could cause permanent damage to your jewelry.

steps.headline: Remove your crystal jewelry before you go swimming, take a shower or bath, or wash your hands.
steps.description: The chlorine in pools and hot tubs can damage the thin plating that protects and gives luster to Swarovski crystal jewelry. Soaps and other body care products can also damage this plating and may cause permanent damage to your jewelry.

steps.headline: Store your crystal jewelry in a soft cloth bag.
steps.description: Keep your Swarovski crystal jewelry separate from other pieces of jewelry in its own bag to prevent scratches or tangles. You may also use your jewelry’s original packaging as storage.

steps.headline: Never use a hard object to clean your crystals.
steps.description: Do not attempt to scrape or scratch off dirt from your Swarovski crystal jewelry. You may scratch the plating in the process, which may cause permanent damage to your jewelry.
